reviews:
1.Camera quality is avarage 7/10
2. Video quality is better with 4k with 60fps 8/10.
3.Video stabilization is awesome 👌 9/10.
I love the overall design, but I hate it because it gets hot real quick . Overall it ok

Display:
The display has a Super Amoled Panel. It has a fast refresh rate of 120hz. The colors are saturated as usual in a Super Amoled panel. The display is very bright as well. It is very smooth. But there is always stutter because of the Adaptive Refresh Rate.

UI:
Packed of features. There is no doubt that Samsung is one of the best UI out there for Android.

Battery:
The phone has 4500mah. Easily lasts a day. Could last even longer if used in 60hz. The phone supports upto 25w charging. It also supports reverse charging. It even supports reverse wireless charging!!

Performance: A top of the line processor by Samsung. Would've been better if the indian version had gotten the Snapdragon 865 chipset. But the 5g Version does have SD 865 but it is much more costlier.

Camera:
The camera sure is 12MP but it takes much more details than expected by a 12MP camera. It is a very capable capable unit under bright environments. But you can see lots of noise in dark environments.

It is a good mobile with decent battery life.
In the beginning the battery dies fast, but after a few days it ges better. I think because of all the updates the battery gets drained very fast.

Camera is really good. Buy it for the camera.
Great delivery and awesome condition with best market price very much satisfied

Display and Camera have top notch quality.

Battery was an issue during the setup. Once my phone was completely set up with all the apps, now the back up has improved
*Tip : Put your phone in Medium Power Saving Mode and you are good to go.
I get one day battery backup with normal usage.
*Note : I don't play games on this device since it is my work phone. Rest of the business apps, calls and camera is used regularly.

Performance is quite okay. Nothing to complain there.

Build quality is great. Just that the back is plastic. But the sides and front seems solid.

It is a 4G phone so do keep that in mind.

Currently on Android 10 and won't be upgrading it since I have experienced that upgrading the phone will actually slow it down and drain the battery.

This is a good midrange phone and I do recommend this.
Battery can be optimised. Performance is okay. Camera and display is best in class.

P.S.  Do not compare it with iPhone. I saw people comparing this phone with iPhone 11/12 on YouTube. Please... this phone comes nowhere. I have iPhone 11 and it is better than this device in all the possible ways.
Battery drain very fast & heating issue

Heating issue
Phone started heating within 5 mins of use. Also Battery drains faster. Do not buy this phone.
Battery is not good  also 15w charger. Phone is heating While using. After taking images no zooming clarity.

I have owned this model since it was launched in India.

My biggest concern has been battery life. I have been extremely disappointed with it as I wasn't able to make it last through the day. The system needs a month or more to understand my usage and optimise battery usage. 

I am always (and I mean all the time) on Bluetooth and WiFi as I work from home. I listen to music all the time. The phone last 6 hours on average. This is far better than the battery life I had at the beginning.

I cannot talk about the camera much as I rarely use it. It's serviceable. 

The screen auto brightness setting is very aggressive sometimes. Dims the screen when it needs to be bright.

The fingerprint scanner is better but becomes unresponsive sometimes. Face recognition is pathetic.

Software is solid. I have Android 11 and things have gotten better. 

Would I recommend it to people? Absolutely not for 41k. It's a phone that should be sold for 35k. It becomes a compelling buy at that point.

I would give this phone 3.5 stars out of 5. I have given it a liberal 4 stars here.

This is my personal opinion of the Vivo V27, based on the experience of using it for the past 15 days.

Pros:

Good primary camera with high resolution and pro mode, which clicks good HD photos.

Front camera is also good, with much clarity.

No lag as of now, indicating good performance.

Light weight, making it easy to carry around.

Cons:

Battery could have been bigger, indicating that we might need to charge it more frequently than you'd like, if we use internet often. Without the usage of 5g internet, battery might hold longer.

Overall, you find it to be a decent mobile phone for its price range of 30-37k. Additionally, I was able to get a good deal on it, thanks to the exchange bonus and credit card offer, which made the purchase even more attractive. 
This is about my thoughts and experiences with the Vivo V27.

- PRV

reviews:
Its been 4 days I'm using this phone of 12 GB variant.

Got open box delivery. (I checked all the contents of the phone ,then I gave delivery OTP). 

7 plus gen 2 is fabulous processor I must say. Superb speed no doubt. 

I ran Antutu version 10 and tested in normal outdoor (heat) condition and indoor (18 degree AC) condition. 

Outdoor I got a score of 1089836 and indoor of 1120582. And thats fantastic. 

Camera is decent, not too good but not bad at all. I don't know why people want DSLR quality from this phone .I personally liked it. (Selfie and back photo attached) . 

Using MIUI is also very exciting and I felt no issues using it. (I Switched from One UI) 

Anyone who needs moderate to heavy usage without lag and decent camera, go for it. 

Finger's crossed after update though. But I trust Poco will not screw up this time. 

Little heating happens when charging. Long battery life. 

Will update review after a month. 

5G speed is good. 

Nice phone!

Update after 2 Months : No issues at all. Best performance. Playing heavy games with no issues. Go for it.

Camera Is excellent💯💯
Performance is also very good👍👍
Using from last 5 month's
Gaming Performance is 🔥 lit. Camera is also good.

Camera - Average performance
Processor - super fast
Design - light weight and handy. 
Screen - superb

After seeing a lot of reviews i was expecting a sub par camera. But it surprised me. Photos came out to be decent. Not exceptional by any means but ok.
The phone is well built and firm. I chose white but now regret it because I like the black one more.
Performance is exceptional. Ui is snappy and fluid. Miui comes with a ton of customisation and bloatware 😅. I uninstalled most of them, which gave me a premium experience.
I didn't find the display to be as good. I could sometimes make out the individual pixels (only when I'm looking for it) which is odd because I was using a redmi note 8 before and I haven't experienced any such issues with it. 
Battery life is phenomenal. Even with 5g and bgmi I endup having about 40% battery left. (Phone was in balanced mode, refresh rate set to automatic and on 5G network.)
Speakers are okay, nothing commendable there. Maybe i was expecting more because of all the Dolby Atmos branding. 
Overall for an average user who prioritises performance over camera, poco F5 delivers. I'm happy with the purchase with a slight regret that I didn't go for the black one.
fingers crossed for the motherboard🥲😵
Most useful device best performance oriented
Never purchase Complete mobile protection plan with phone it's just a trick to collect extra money in the name of insurance.

reviews:
Excellent product 
Camera,
Performance,
Display,
Build quality,
Speakers,
Haptics motor,
UI, everything is just up to the mark

1. Nice camera (Good stabilization) 🎥
2. Good battery backup ( charges in 33mins ) 🔋
3. BGMI super smooth 👌
4. Awesome design , very slim. 📱
5. Although display is good but when compared with realme GT Neo 2 , peak brightness is slightly low on playing HDR videos but normal brightness is same.
6. Mic quality is not good , hope they solve this issue on software update. 🎤
7. Dolby Atmos is awesome for watching movies but for listening songs it won't be better unlike Xiaomi sound equalizer.🎵
8. It has a special feature 'MEMC' which makes the starting, ending Animations of videos Smoother(60fps)
Suggestion: For battery draining issues, please disable some unnecessary apps(Quick device connect)which consume more power.

Camera is performing good and excellent
Design was terrific and primium look it have.
Awesome Stabilization it works perfect.
Smooth and primium experience.

Reasons to BUY:-
•Crisp display with 120hz screen refresh rate and 360hz touch sampling rate.
•SDG 888 though an older chipset, is optimised for this phone and doesn't heats up that much Plus the RAW power you get will be enough for majority users.
•Form factor , the phone looks premium for the price.
•Excellent Haptics! Midrange phones lack in Haptics department, this phone doesn't.
•Games Run smooth from BGMI to GENSHIN IMPACT(Medium settings)
•If you're not into Stock Android, This UI gives you the best of both worlds : Customisation+Snappy. Realme UI is much more polished than Oxygen OS/ ColorOS, MIUI, Funtouch etc.
•Overall Good Rear camera with OIS. Nightmode is decent.
•Unexpectedly Good battery that gives you a SOT of 7-8 hours on medium to heavy usage , and that 65W charges your Phone from 20-100% in almost 30mins. Realme Nailed on this one!
•3 years of Android Updates and 4 years of security updates! (Same as Samsung)

Reasons to NOT BUY:-
•Ergonomically the phone is quite Bulky. 
•NO Headphone jack.
•Front camera is average. 16Mp at this price point feels like cost cutting.
•No Telephoto lens or a better ultra wide camera.
•You like Stock Android and bloatware free experience.
•Updates are not regular like OneUI.

VERDICT: 
A decent Buy for the Price point. The camera(s) (except the main camera) is the major thing that disappointed me. Otherwise the Performance has no issues and Realme UI provides you with ample customisation as well as smooth experience.

Total experience is very good. 
Night Short is Good.

1. Good Camera
2. Better battery 🔋
3. Display, sound all are good. Worth for money.

Posting this review after 3 days of usage. 
📸 CAMERA: 9/10, the rear camera is amazing, produces great quality pictures! Front camera is good but could've been better. One of my main priorities was camera, and I am impressed.

📱DISPLAY: 10/10, 120hz Display is super smooth & works flawlessly with vivid colors

🔋 BATTERY LIFE: 9/10, I would've given it a 10/10 if the "quick device connect" was not turned on by default. For the first two days my battery drained very fast, when checked in settings, quick device connect consumed 60% of it and I couldn't find a way to turn it off for hours until I found it in Enhancement settings.
Battery life has been amazing without the quick device connect feature! Make sure to turn it off if you're buying

🎮 PROCESSOR: 9/10 Snapdragon 888 performs it's best! Initially the device heated up during normal use too, but once I turned off the "quick device connect" feature, it has been cool. And just heats up during heavy gaming and charging.

🔌 CHARGING: 10/10 The 65w charger does wonders and my phone is charged to 100% in about 30-40 minutes depending on whether wifi, location, data are turned on during charging or not. Naturally the phone heats up during charging.

📳 USER INTERFACE: 8/10 Realme UI 3.0 is good but has a few bugs which definitely need to be fixed. Unlike usually the power menu isn't accessible by just long pressing the power button. I had to research on the internet to find out that the power menu is accessible by clicking power and volume up button simultaneously.
The "quick device connect" issue is big, and for many, will be difficult to diagnose and disable. Hopefully these bugs are fixed with future updates. After hours of research on the internet I was able to fix the battery drain and heating issue.

🙌🏻OVERALL: The phone is an absolute value for your money. Has so many features packed into one, hardly any cons I can think of. After fixing the issues the phone is Perfect! Everything I could ever ask for in an affordable price range.
Keeping the above in mind, go ahead and buy it, you will not regret. 

Will update the review if I ever come across any other problems/bugs.

reviews:
The real review about MoTo g54 5G. Please read before buy...Thanks !!
The major problem in this phone is the connectivity issue. Brand says 4X4 mimo connectivity, but in this i didn't feel any strong connectivity regarding Wifi. Even my Vivo v19 having only 4G connectivity stays connected to wifi for upto 2 meters distance more than this version of Motorola. ALSO, when my operator connectivity changes from 5G to 4G then i have to manually change the connectivity also in Mobile sim settings. So my suggestion is that please provides sim connectivity settings to Auto mode so that automatic change to 4G or 5G whenever operator network changes. Next is only screen display, colours, multitasking etc. is in fluid performance. Camera quality is like u can say that plastic type picture are taken by this version. No complaints about OIS. But still photo taken in motion have no single performance. As result, picture are blurred. I hope these some problems could be resolved by such like a good brand Motorola. I hope my review helps to buyers. Thanks 👍
Overall Nice phone.. battery backup is awesome.Camera really good and decent..at this price range it's complete product.. without any second thought go for it.👍

Capture picturesque images of landscapes or mountains and even amazing close-up shots as this smartphone comes with a triple-rear-camera setup (12 MP Ultra Wide Camera, 12 MP Wide-angle Camera, and 8 MP Telephoto Camera). reviews:
1.Camera quality is avarage 7/10
2. Video quality is better with 4k with 60fps 8/10.
3.Video stabilization is awesome 👌 9/10.
I love the overall design, but I hate it because it gets hot real quick . Overall it ok

Display:
The display has a Super Amoled Panel. It has a fast refresh rate of 120hz. The colors are saturated as usual in a Super Amoled panel. The display is very bright as well. It is very smooth. But there is always stutter because of the Adaptive Refresh Rate.

UI:
Packed of features. There is no doubt that Samsung is one of the best UI out there for Android.

Battery:
The phone has 4500mah. Easily lasts a day. Could last even longer if used in 60hz. The phone supports upto 25w charging. It also supports reverse charging. It even supports reverse wireless charging!!

Performance: A top of the line processor by Samsung. Would've been better if the indian version had gotten the Snapdragon 865 chipset. But the 5g Version does have SD 865 but it is much more costlier.

Camera:
The camera sure is 12MP but it takes much more details than expected by a 12MP camera. It is a very capable capable unit under bright environments. But you can see lots of noise in dark environments.

It is a good mobile with decent battery life.
In the beginning the battery dies fast, but after a few days it ges better. I think because of all the updates the battery gets drained very fast.

Camera is really good. Buy it for the camera.
Great delivery and awesome condition with best market price very much satisfied

Display and Camera have top notch quality.

Battery was an issue during the setup. Once my phone was completely set up with all the apps, now the back up has improved
*Tip : Put your phone in Medium Power Saving Mode and you are good to go.
I get one day battery backup with normal usage.
*Note : I don't play games on this device since it is my work phone. Rest of the business apps, calls and camera is used regularly.

Performance is quite okay. Nothing to complain there.

Build quality is great. Just that the back is plastic. But the sides and front seems solid.

It is a 4G phone so do keep that in mind.

Currently on Android 10 and won't be upgrading it since I have experienced that upgrading the phone will actually slow it down and drain the battery.

This is a good midrange phone and I do recommend this.
Battery can be optimised. Performance is okay. Camera and display is best in class.

P.S.  Do not compare it with iPhone. I saw people comparing this phone with iPhone 11/12 on YouTube. Please... this phone comes nowhere. I have iPhone 11 and it is better than this device in all the possible ways.
Battery drain very fast & heating issue

Heating issue
Phone started heating within 5 mins of use. Also Battery drains faster. Do not buy this phone.

I have owned this model since it was launched in India.

My biggest concern has been battery life. I have been extremely disappointed with it as I wasn't able to make it last through the day. The system needs a month or more to understand my usage and optimise battery usage. 

I am always (and I mean all the time) on Bluetooth and WiFi as I work from home. I listen to music all the time. The phone last 6 hours on average. This is far better than the battery life I had at the beginning.

I cannot talk about the camera much as I rarely use it. It's serviceable. 

The screen auto brightness setting is very aggressive sometimes. Dims the screen when it needs to be bright.

The fingerprint scanner is better but becomes unresponsive sometimes. Face recognition is pathetic.

Software is solid. I have Android 11 and things have gotten better. 

Would I recommend it to people? Absolutely not for 41k. It's a phone that should be sold for 35k. It becomes a compelling buy at that point.

I would give this phone 3.5 stars out of 5. I have given it a liberal 4 stars here.
Battery is not good  also 15w charger. Phone is heating While using. After taking images no zooming clarity.

reviews:
Its been 4 days I'm using this phone of 12 GB variant.

Got open box delivery. (I checked all the contents of the phone ,then I gave delivery OTP). 

7 plus gen 2 is fabulous processor I must say. Superb speed no doubt. 

I ran Antutu version 10 and tested in normal outdoor (heat) condition and indoor (18 degree AC) condition. 

Outdoor I got a score of 1089836 and indoor of 1120582. And thats fantastic. 

Camera is decent, not too good but not bad at all. I don't know why people want DSLR quality from this phone .I personally liked it. (Selfie and back photo attached) . 

Using MIUI is also very exciting and I felt no issues using it. (I Switched from One UI) 

Anyone who needs moderate to heavy usage without lag and decent camera, go for it. 

Finger's crossed after update though. But I trust Poco will not screw up this time. 

Little heating happens when charging. Long battery life. 

Will update review after a month. 

5G speed is good. 

Nice phone!

Update after 2 Months : No issues at all. Best performance. Playing heavy games with no issues. Go for it.

Camera Is excellent💯💯
Performance is also very good👍👍
Using from last 5 month's
Gaming Performance is 🔥 lit. Camera is also good.

Camera - Average performance
Processor - super fast
Design - light weight and handy. 
Screen - superb

After seeing a lot of reviews i was expecting a sub par camera. But it surprised me. Photos came out to be decent. Not exceptional by any means but ok.
The phone is well built and firm. I chose white but now regret it because I like the black one more.
Performance is exceptional. Ui is snappy and fluid. Miui comes with a ton of customisation and bloatware 😅. I uninstalled most of them, which gave me a premium experience.
I didn't find the display to be as good. I could sometimes make out the individual pixels (only when I'm looking for it) which is odd because I was using a redmi note 8 before and I haven't experienced any such issues with it. 
Battery life is phenomenal. Even with 5g and bgmi I endup having about 40% battery left. (Phone was in balanced mode, refresh rate set to automatic and on 5G network.)
Speakers are okay, nothing commendable there. Maybe i was expecting more because of all the Dolby Atmos branding. 
Overall for an average user who prioritises performance over camera, poco F5 delivers. I'm happy with the purchase with a slight regret that I didn't go for the black one.
fingers crossed for the motherboard🥲😵
Most useful device best performance oriented
Never purchase Complete mobile protection plan with phone it's just a trick to collect extra money in the name of insurance.

reviews:
Reviewing after 5 full days of use.

Take a leap of faith and buy it. You won't be disappointed. Period.

I had my first rendezvous with Motorola via Moto G (3rd Gen) when it was launched and gosh the phone is still working after 8 years!! That Motorola from a quality stand point. Interim I deviated to Redmi, Honor, Samsung however didn't had the sturdiness and reliability as offered by Moto.

Coming to this one:-

Looks and build quality are premium (I got the satin color). Very Positive
I am not into gaming and after regular usage for 2 days battery is still at 46%. Charging via 33W charger was very brisk. Very Positive
Thanks to 8GB RAM and SD 680 processor, Phone is pretty fast and responsive - from installing apps to working on them. Very Positive
Camera: You can't make everyone happy around few things - Food, Shift roster, Transport pick n drop and Phone camera. There will always be people who expect DSLR functionality from phone camera which no phone can offer. This one won't disappoint you at least. Positive
Dolby Atmos : Sound is amazingly good. Not only clear but volume can be pretty high. On external blue-tooth speaker, this phone puts 20W TV to shame. Very positive.
Its not mentioned in the product catalogue however one also get a soft transparent phone cover in the box. Pleasant surprise!  Positive

At worst one may not like the limited preloaded ringtones the phone has got (if one goes about a fault finding spree) however no negatives from me. 

Final verdict : Hello Moto!

Super smart phone at a very reasonable price.
The same configuration mobile costs more than 15 for different brands. This is 3rd Moto phone in my life. I purchased moto because its build quality is much stronger than other smart phones, and its resale value is very good. Without any doubt you can go for it.

5. Sound is very loud

7. Screen touch very smooth

9. Performance is best
10. Light weight mobile

reviews:
I recently purchased the Motorola G14 , and I must say, I'm quite disappointed with my experience.

While I've always been a fan of Motorola's products, this particular phone has left me with some significant concerns. Within just a few days of use, it started displaying frequent freezing and hanging issues, which was incredibly frustrating. What's even more concerning is the network-related problems, such as call disconnections and difficulties receiving calls. This is especially problematic since this phone is intended for my less tech-savvy mother, who relies heavily on it for communication.

My initial attempt to return the phone through Flipkart was met with a message directing me to contact the authorized brand service center. While I understand the need for such procedures, it's disheartening that I couldn't resolve this issue directly through the platform I made the purchase from.

I'm now in contact with Motorola's customer support, and I'm hopeful they will assist in initiating a return or exchange process. Nevertheless, this experience has been far from what I expected, and it has left me questioning the quality and reliability of Motorola's products. I sincerely hope that Motorola responds promptly to my inquiry; otherwise, it would be very disappointing.

*Reasons to buy*
Long-lasting battery life
FHD+ display
Dolby Atmos speakers are impressive
UI is clean and easy to use 

*Reasons not to buy*
Processor not better
Slow charging speed

reviews: After using it for quite some time, frustrated and disgusted I thought it'd be important to write this review so as to save others from the same ordeal I go through everyday using this phone. First is the camera quality. Is 48 MP, but feels like 8MP. Pathetic sound quality. Phone hangs already. And is slow even if it has got 8gb RAM. No bloat ware was fine,  but this phone is so rudimentary that in order to open a pic taken, I had to download some app. In order to just crop a pic I had to download another app. In order to send a message I had to download another app. It is so dumb that whenever in a dark room the phone tells me to remove my hand from the top part of the phone thinking I am covering it with my hand. And the worst is typing using swipe. No matter how many times I swipe over the same words to let the mobile learn new words (bengali words typed through swipe, in English) it forgets. I haven't seen such a forgetful phone ever. Dumbest phone I've ever used.
Do not buy this product. Waste of money

reviews:
The real review about MoTo g54 5G. Please read before buy...Thanks !!
The major problem in this phone is the connectivity issue. Brand says 4X4 mimo connectivity, but in this i didn't feel any strong connectivity regarding Wifi. Even my Vivo v19 having only 4G connectivity stays connected to wifi for upto 2 meters distance more than this version of Motorola. ALSO, when my operator connectivity changes from 5G to 4G then i have to manually change the connectivity also in Mobile sim settings. So my suggestion is that please provides sim connectivity settings to Auto mode so that automatic change to 4G or 5G whenever operator network changes. Next is only screen display, colours, multitasking etc. is in fluid performance. Camera quality is like u can say that plastic type picture are taken by this version. No complaints about OIS. But still photo taken in motion have no single performance. As result, picture are blurred. I hope these some problems could be resolved by such like a good brand Motorola. I hope my review helps to buyers. Thanks 👍
Overall Nice phone.. battery backup is awesome.Camera really good and decent..at this price range it's complete product.. without any second thought go for it.👍

✓This is the Flagship Phone at a very good price point. Review after 1 week of usage.

1. Camera
•The primary lens is simply magical. All light conditions it stands out. OIS works well.
See some of the camera sample.
•Lets not talk about macro.
•Wide angle is okish
• Selfie camera is also good

2. Display
• The Buttery Smooth, E4 panel is treat to eye and also treat to the hands considering the refresh rates.

3.Battery
• 5000mAh + 65w charger is beast of a combo.
I can get SOT of around 5+ hours.
• From 10% it consistently gets full charges in around 35 37 mins.

4. Processor and overall Performance
• 888 is Flagship indeed.
Tested ASPHALT 9 , works like a charm.
Haven't tested other games.
•  But overall the thermals are well managed while gaming and while prolonged use of cameras even in this summer heat of 40°

5. Realme UI 3.0
• I have used OnePlus phones in past.
•I really like Realme UI 3.0
Its is close to stock with very good customisation features . AOD , Edge Lighting work like a charm.
• Bloatware can be removed and there are no ads.


Overall this is a complete package and must have for this price point.

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐ (4/5 stars)

I recently purchased the HP Pavilion 15 laptop, and I must say, I'm thoroughly impressed by its sleek design and overall features at this price point. Here's my comprehensive review covering all its important Pros and Cons :

✔️ Pros -

📍Good Performance
📍Sleek and Durable Design
📍Vibrant Display
📍Comfortable Keyboard
📍Good Audio Quality

✖️ Cons -

📍Battery life could be slightly better
📍Camera quality really needs a lot of improvement

📌 DETAILED REVIEW OF ITS FEATURES

1) PERFORMANCE
The laptop is powered by an AMD Ryzen 5 5625U Processor (up to 4.3 GHz max boost clock, 16 MB L3 cache, 6 cores, 12 threads) and 16GB of RAM, making multitasking and running demanding applications easier. It supports medium level editing and gaming as specifically its not a gaming oriented laptop with no additional graphics card.

2) DISPLAY
The Full HD 15.6-inch display with micro-edge bezels offers an immersive viewing experience. Colors are vibrant, and the brightness levels are adequate for both indoor and outdoor use. Whether I'm streaming movies or working on design projects, the display quality truly shines.

3) DESIGN
The laptop's sleek and minimalist design caught my eye right away. The metal chassis not only gives it a premium feel but also adds durability to the device. The slim profile and lightweight design make it easy to carry around, making it suitable for both work and leisure.

4) KEYBOARD AND TOUCHPAD
The keyboard is well-spaced and comfortable for long typing sessions. The keys are backlit, which is a nice touch for working in low-light conditions. The touchpad is responsive and supports multi-finger gestures effectively.

5) AUDIO
The Bang and Olufsen speakers deliver clear and loud audio. Whether I'm watching movies, playing music, or attending virtual meetings, the sound quality remains consistent.

6) BATTERY LIFE
The battery life is decent but could be slightly better, providing around 5-6 hours of usage on a single charge with moderate usage. While not the longest battery life, it's sufficient for a day's work or entertainment.

7) CONNECTIVITY
The laptop offers a good range of ports, including 1 SuperSpeed USB Type-C 10Gbps signaling rate (USB Power Delivery, DisplayPort 1.4, HP Sleep and Charge); 2 SuperSpeed USB Type-A 5Gbps signaling rate; 1 HDMI 2.1; 1 AC smart pin; 1 headphone/microphone combo. Realtek Wi-Fi 6 (2x2) and Bluetooth 5.2 combo (Supporting Gigabit data rate). This combination ensures seamless connectivity with various devices.

8) SOFTWARE
The laptop comes with Windows 11 pre-installed, and I appreciate the lack of bloatwares, which often plagues other laptops.

📌 ADDITIONAL FEATURES
